news.title: Alibaba's Qwen 3.5 397B-A17 beats its larger trillion-parameter model
news.snippet: The new flagship open-weight model — Qwen3.5-397B-A17B — packs 397 billion total parameters but activates only 17 billion per token. It is claiming benchmark wins against Alibaba's own previous flagship, Qwen3-Max.

news.title: Anthropic's Sonnet 4.6 matches flagship AI performance at one-fifth the cost
news.snippet: The model is a full upgrade across coding, computer use, long-context reasoning, agent planning, knowledge work, and design. It features a 1M token context window in beta.

news.title: OpenAI's acquisition of OpenClaw signals the beginning of the end of the ChatGPT era
news.snippet: The chatbot era may have just received its obituary. Peter Steinberger, the creator of OpenClaw — the open-source AI agent that took the developer world by storm — announced he is joining OpenAI.

news.title: Qodo 2.1 solves your coding agents' 'amnesia' problem
news.snippet: Qodo 2.1 brings memory to AI coding tools, boosting precision by 11% and solving the problem of forgetting previous work after closing a session.

news.title: Nvidia, Groq and the limestone race to real-time AI
news.snippet: From data centers to edge devices, real-time AI inference has become the new battleground for tech giants.

tech.title: Nvidia's new technique cuts LLM reasoning costs by 8x without losing accuracy
tech.snippet: Nvidia researchers developed dynamic memory sparsification (DMS), a technique that compresses the KV cache in large language models by up to 8x while maintaining reasoning accuracy.

tech.title: When accurate AI is still dangerously incomplete
tech.snippet: LexisNexis' chief AI officer explains why standard RAG fails in high-stakes legal AI — and how graph RAG, planner agents, and reflection agents are closing the gap.

tech.title: The path to ubiquitous AI (17k tokens/second)
tech.snippet: Exploring how to achieve AI inference processing 17,000 tokens per second, driving AI towards ubiquity.

tech.title: Minions - Stripe's coding agents (Part 2)
tech.snippet: Stripe shares development experience and technical details of its one-shot end-to-end coding agent.

tutorial.title: Learn codebases with visualization tools
tutorial.snippet: More efficiently understand large project structures by building code visualization tools.

tutorial.title: Web Components: The framework-free renaissance
tutorial.snippet: The revival of Web Components in modern web development, native component development without frameworks.

tutorial.title: Building AI agents from scratch
tutorial.snippet: A comprehensive guide to building AI agents from the ground up, covering architecture and implementation.

fun.title: AI agents turned Super Bowl viewers into one high-IQ team
fun.snippet: Imagine this in the enterprise — how AI agents could transform collaborative decision-making across large organizations.

fun.title: Child's Play: Tech's new generation and the end of thinking
fun.snippet: Exploring how the new generation's tech environment affects thinking patterns, and AI's impact on this.

fun.title: No skill, no taste
fun.snippet: Thoughts on creative work in the AI era — when technology barriers lower, taste becomes more important.
